grammarNote.title: Conditional: たら
grammarNote.explanation: たら expresses 'if/when' — it's formed by adding ら to the past tense: いく→いったら (if [we] go), ある→あったら (if there is). 海岸にいったらいい means 'it would be nice if we went to the coast.' たら is the most versatile conditional in Japanese — it works for hypotheticals, temporal sequences, and discovered results.

examples.japanese: 海岸 に いったら いい ね。
examples.english: It'd be nice if [we] went to the coast.
